I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq

Qed.```

Example 2:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat
y: pos n
x: pos n
Hxy: x <> y
i: nat

Goal:
length (increment i) = 15

Premises:
increment = fun i : nat => PUSH y Zero :: transfer_ones x y (1 + i) (5 + i) (10 + i) One ++ PUSH x One :: transfer_ones y x (6 + i) (15 + i) (15 + i) Zero ++ PUSH x Zero :: transfer_ones y x (11 + i) (15 + i) (15 + i) Zero ++ nil : nat -> list (bsm_instr n) Arguments increment _%nat_scope
length : forall A : Type, list A -> nat
Notation pos := Fin.t
length_move_rev_stack : forall (x y : pos n) (i : nat), length (move_rev_stack x y i) = 7
copy_stack_length : forall (x y z : pos n) (i : nat), length (copy_stack x y z i) = 16
length_copy_rev_stack : forall (x y z : pos n) (i : nat), length (copy_rev_stack x y z i) = 9
copy_stack_spec : forall x y z : pos n, x <> y -> x <> z -> y <> z -> forall (i : nat) (l : list bool) (v w : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = l -> v#>z = nil -> w = v[(l ++ v#>y)/y] -> (i, copy_stack x y z i) // (i, v) -> > (16 + i, w)
copy_rev_stack_spec : forall x y z : pos n, x <> y -> x <> z -> y <> z -> forall (i : nat) (l : list bool) (v w : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = l -> w = v[nil/x][(rev l ++ v#>y)/y][(rev l ++ v#>z)/z] -> (i, copy_rev_stack x y z i) // (i, v) -> > (9 + i, w)
move_rev_stack_spec : forall x y : pos n, x <> y -> forall (i : nat) (l : list bool) (v w : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = l -> w = v[nil/x][(rev l ++ v#>y)/y] -> (i, move_rev_stack x y i) // (i, v) -> > (7 + i, w)
empty_stack_length : forall (x : pos n) (i : nat), length (empty_stack x i) = 3
compare_stack_spec : forall x y : pos n, x <> y -> forall (i p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n), exists (j : nat) (w : vec (list bool) n), (i, compare_stacks x y i p q) // (i, v) -> > (j, w) /\ (forall z : pos n, z <> x -> z <> y -> v#>z = w#>z /\ (v#>x = v#>y /\ j = p \/ v#>x <> v#>y /\ j = q))
move_rev_stack = fun (x y : pos n) (i : nat) => let y' := y in POP x (4 + i) (7 + i) :: PUSH y One :: PUSH y' Zero :: POP y' i i :: PUSH y Zero :: PUSH x Zero :: POP x i i :: nil : pos n -> pos n -> nat -> list (bsm_instr n) Arguments move_rev_stack _ _ _%nat_scope
compare_stack_eq_spec : forall x y : pos n, x <> y -> forall (i p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = v#>y -> exists w : vec (list bool) n, (i, compare_stacks x y i p q) // (i, v) -> > (p, w) /\ (forall z : pos n, z <> x -> z <> y -> v#>z = w#>z)
cs_spec_rec : forall x y : pos n, x <> y -> forall (i p q : nat) (l m : list bool) (v : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = l -> v#>y = m -> exists w : vec (list bool) n, (forall z : pos n, z <> x -> z <> y -> v#>z = w#>z) /\ (l = m -> (i, compare_stacks x y i p q) // (i, v) ->> (p, w)) /\ (l <> m -> (i, compare_stacks x y i p q) // (i, v) ->> (q, w))
compare_stack_neq_spec : forall x y : pos n, x <> y -> forall (i p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n), v#>x <> v#>y -> exists w : vec (list bool) n, (i, compare_stacks x y i p q) // (i, v) -> > (q, w) /\ (forall z : pos n, z <> x -> z <> y -> v#>z = w#>z)
tile_length : forall (x y : pos n) (high low : list bool), length (tile x y high low) = length high + length low
Fin.eq_dec : forall x0 y0 : pos ?n, {x0 = y0} + {x0 <> y0} where ?n : [n : nat x : pos n y : pos n Hxy : x <> y i : nat |- nat]
copy_rev_stack = fun (x y z : pos n) (i : nat) => let y' := y in POP x (5 + i) (9 + i) :: PUSH y One :: PUSH z One :: PUSH y' Zero :: POP y' i i :: PUSH y Zero :: PUSH z Zero :: PUSH x Zero :: POP x i i :: nil : pos n -> pos n -> pos n -> nat -> list (bsm_instr n) Arguments copy_rev_stack _ _ _ _%nat_scope
compare_stacks = fun (x y : pos n) (i p q : nat) => let x' := x in POP x (4 + i) (7 + i) :: POP y q q :: PUSH x Zero :: POP x i i :: POP y i q :: PUSH y Zero :: POP y q i :: POP y q p :: PUSH x' Zero :: POP x' q q :: nil : pos n -> pos n -> nat -> nat -> nat -> list (bsm_instr n) Arguments compare_stacks _ _ (_ _ _)%nat_scope
copy_stack = fun (x y z : pos n) (i : nat) => move_rev_stack x z i ++ copy_rev_stack z x y (7 + i) : pos n -> pos n -> pos n -> nat -> list (bsm_instr n) Arguments copy_stack _ _ _ _%nat_scope
VectorSpec.nth_map2 : forall (f : ?A -> ?B -> ?C) (n0 : nat) (v : vec ?A n0) (w : vec ?B n0) (p1 p2 p3 : pos n0), p1 = p2 -> p2 = p3 -> VectorDef.nth (VectorDef.map2 f v w) p1 = f (VectorDef.nth v p2) (VectorDef.nth w p3) where ?A : [n : nat x : pos n y : pos n Hxy : x <> y i : nat |- Type] ?B : [n : nat x : pos n y : pos n Hxy : x <> y i : nat |- Type] ?C : [n : nat x : pos n y : pos n Hxy : x <> y i : nat |- Type]
Fin.FS_inj : forall x0 y0 : pos ?n, pos_nxt x0 = pos_nxt y0 -> x0 = y0 where ?n : [n : nat x : pos n y : pos n Hxy : x <> y i : nat |- nat]
VectorSpec.nth_map : forall (f : ?A -> ?B) (n0 : nat) (v : vec ?A n0) (p1 p2 : pos n0), p1 = p2 -> VectorDef.nth (VectorDef.map f v) p1 = f (VectorDef.nth v p2) where ?A : [n : nat x : pos n y : pos n Hxy : x <> y i : nat |- Type] ?B : [n : nat x : pos n y : pos n Hxy : x <> y i : nat |- Type]
compare_stacks_length : forall (x y : pos n) (i p q : nat), length (compare_stacks x y i p q) = 10
pos_S_inv : forall p : pos (S ?n), (p = pos0) + {q : pos ?n | p = pos_nxt q} where ?n : [n : nat x : pos n y : pos n Hxy : x <> y i : nat |- nat]

VectorDef.map2 : (?A -> ?B -> ?C) -> forall n0 : nat, vec ?A n0 -> vec ?B n0 -> vec ?C n0 where ?A : [n : nat x : pos n y : pos n Hxy : x <> y i : nat |- Type] ?B : [n : nat x : pos n y : pos n Hxy : x <> y i : nat |- Type] ?C : [n : nat x : pos n y : pos n Hxy : x <> y i : nat |- Type]
VectorDef.map : (?A -> ?B) -> forall n0 : nat, vec ?A n0 -> vec ?B n0 where ?A : [n : nat x : pos n y : pos n Hxy : x <> y i : nat |- Type] ?B : [n : nat x : pos n y : pos n Hxy : x <> y i : nat |- Type]
pos_eq_dec : forall (n : nat) (x y : pos n), {x = y} + {x <> y}
tile_spec : forall x y : pos n, x <> y -> forall (high low : list bool) (i : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (st : nat * vec (list bool) n), st = (length (tile x y high low) + i, v[(high ++ v#>x)/x][(low ++ v#>y)/y]) -> (i, tile x y high low) // (i, v) -> > st
transfer_ones_spec_2 : forall x y : pos n, x <> y -> forall (i p q : nat) (b : bool) (k : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (st : nat * vec (list bool) n), v#>x = list_repeat One k -> st = (q, v[nil/x][(list_repeat b k ++ v#>y)/y]) -> (i, transfer_ones x y i p q b) // (i, v) -> > st
Fin.L_R : forall n0 : nat, pos ?m -> pos (n0 + ?m) where ?m : [n : nat x : pos n y : pos n Hxy : x <> y i : nat |- nat]
